metadata.title: CVE-2016-8649 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
lxc-attach in LXC before 1.0.9 and 2.x before 2.0.6 allows an attackerinside of an unprivileged container to use an inherited file descriptor, ofthe host's /proc, to access the rest of the host's filesystem via theopenat() family of syscalls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8649` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
lua-lxc - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
lxc - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
lxc-common - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
lxc-templates - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
lxc-tests - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
lxc1 - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
python3-lxc - 2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.5-0ubuntu1~ubuntu16.04.3').
